admin_token.description: HTTP authorization bearer token for accessing publisher admin endpoints. If None, remote admin operations will be disabled (only self-publish will work).

api_bind_addrs.description: Addresses for client interaction - resolver lookups, publishing, and admin. Required for publisher and resolver.  This serves both token-protected and public endpoints.

global_addrs.description: How to determine the public ip for publisher announcements and self-publishing. Publisher announcements always use the first address.

identity.description: An backed identity (by file or card) this server can use as its own.  See the structure fields for more information on what this provides.

node.description: Core DHT node config, for publishing and looking up addresses

persistent_dir.description: Path to a dir for subsystems to store persistent data (mostly sqlite databases). Will be created if it doesn't exist.

BackedIdentityArg.description: An identity with its associated secret.

oneOf.description: A file containing a generated key

tcp_bind_addrs.description: TCP for DNS over TLS. Please set up your own TLS reverse proxy.

oneOf.description: Use this if you know the IP address beforehand (ex: in terraform, if you allocate a floating ip before provisioning this host) and it's not the address of any local interface.

If your server is directly on the internet (with an externally reachable IP configured on an interface) this will cause that IP to be used. Specify an interface name (ex: `eth0`) or leave blank to scan all interfaces for a public IP.  All ipv6 addresses are considered public.

ip_version.description: Restrict to ip addresses of this version; unrestricted if empty.

name.description: Restrict to an interface with this name (like `eth0`); unrestricted if empty.

oneOf.description: Look up a socket address via a remote service (ex: whatismyip). The service must reply with the ip address as plain text.

contact_ip_ver.description: Which ip protocol to use to contact lookup server (hence: which ip ver the lookup server will see and return).  If empty, use any ip version.

lookup.description: Host to look up address on.

bind_addr.description: The address the node will listen on (UDP).

bootstrap.description: A list of peers to use to bootstrap the connection.

advertise_port.description: Port the publisher is externally reachable on, for advertisements (if different from bind port).

bind_addr.description: Port to bind for serving published data to other nodes

dns_bridge.description: Specify to enable the DNS bridge.

max_cache.description: Maximum number of entries (identity, key pairs) in resolver cache.

self_publish.description: Wait for a local interface configured with a public ip and publish it using this server's identity.

self_tls.description: Retrieve a TLS cert for the identity's domain (`.s`) and configure TLS on the public endpoint (https instead of http) via `certipasta.isandrew.com`.

StrSocketAddr.description: An ip address or domain (ex: "localhost") which resolves to an address
